title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message: I had a bit of spillage on the board but nothing around smc or charging Ic. What diode reading should I be getting around C7117 (PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R)  Im getting 0.113v on diode. Im  getting 8.6v on Q7155 pin 5

title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message:
That value is good.

Do you get correct PPBUS_G3H voltage?
Check it without battery.

Check R6950 and post voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message:
PPBUS_G3H is 8.59v without battery

r6950 is fine at 10k
Scl/Sda lines are 0.445v diode mode and 3.3v on both

I dont have another battery to verify if battery is bad.

title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message:
"... post voltage ..."
???

You should discard battery, to avoid wasting time with an working board...

title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message: As this had water damage as previous mentioned I wanted to make sure board was reading ok before buying a battery as they are expensive and I dont see many 11" mac air's.

title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message:
Find an old battery, just for test.
Must be known good working, of course.

title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message: Thanks for your input I have ordered a new battery and will work from there.

title: 820-3435-B not detecting battery
message:
Be aware of new chinese battery!
I saw too many problems caused by these bulshits...
